channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: FirstUp: UN Security Council to meet over US action in Venezuela and other big headlines
Why hushpitality and rail travel will be the travel trends of 2026
What comes next for Venezuela after Nicolas Maduro’s capture?
Rial is the Word of the Week: How Iran’s currency has plunged the country into turmoil
Who is Cilia Flores, Nicolas Maduro’s wife also captured by US?
This Week in Explainers: Conflict, protests, and fire: How 2026 started on a rocky note
How Saudi-UAE rivalry in Yemen could impact already fragile West Asia
item.description: In the context of Yemen, geography is both an asset and a liability, as its strategic location on the Bab el-Mandeb Strait offers control over critical maritime routes but also exposes it to regional conflicts and foreign interventions

item.title: India needs sharp pragmatism in Myanmar as elections set stage for Junta
item.description: After the elections, China will further expand its influence in Myanmar, which could affect India’s influence and regional security as well. India must have all its negotiating levers ready, even if it is through hard power

item.title: How Congress, Pentagon contain Potus overreach and how India should leverage it
item.description: Congress acts overtly through laws and funding, while the Pentagon uses threat assessments and signals. These serve as checks on presidential excesses and preserve strategic continuity, even if the White House moves toward ideological retrenchment

item.title: Brotherhood under strain: How Saudi-UAE power play in Sudan, Yemen deepens regional instability
item.description: Riyadh and Abu Dhabi have often diverged on several issues, from oil quotas to positions on various Afro-Arab conflicts, including the Israel-Hamas war, the Abraham Accords, and increasing proximity to Israel

item.title: Bangladesh: How Yunus regime’s mobocracy has weaponised the persecution of minorities
item.description: By refusing to acknowledge the communal nature of the violence, the Yunus administration sent a clear signal: mobs would not be restrained

item.title: INSV Kaundinya: India’s push towards maritime decolonisation, reclaiming civilisational legacy
item.description: INSV Kaundinya’s maiden overseas voyage reclaims India’s centuries-old maritime legacy, challenging colonial narratives that painted the subcontinent as land-bound
